channel.title: Symmetric Algorithms on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in Symmetric Algorithms on Analyst

item.title: Viginear
item.description: Viginear cypher is more sophisticated than the Caesar cypher. Since the key is several characters long and the length is unknown, the frequency analysis technique becomes more challenging.

item.title: AES
item.description: Thi is the next generation. 128-bit blocks, 128,192, 256 keys. Takes too much time to brute force.

item.title: Caesar's Cipher
item.description: In this article I’m dissecting a very well known (and that’s why not advisable to be used) cryptographic algorithm which is better known for IT tribe as “ROT13”.

item.title: DES
item.description: DES - Symmetric. Data Encryption Standard. NIST 1993. 56 bit key, 64-bit plaintext input (blocks). How secure?

item.title: One-time Pad
item.description: One-time pad is like a Viginear cypher but with the key the length of the cypher text.
